citations.quote: PtoMYB156 was able to significantly repress expression of the GUS reporter gene under the control of the PtrCESA17, PtrC4H2 and PtrGT43B promoters
the expression of several secondary wall-associated transcription factors, PtoMYB003/018/020/021/028/152, were repressed, while PtoKNAT7 ... was induced
A hierarchical network of transcription factors has been proposed to control secondary wall formation in plants.

items.expression_pattern: Widely expressed; predominant in leaves and developing wood cells

items.tissue_or_stage: vascular tissues of roots, stems, leaf veins
items.expression_pattern: GUS detected in all tissues, especially vascular

citations.quote: PtoMYB156 is widely expressed in all tissues examined, but predominantly in leaves and developing wood cells.
The PtoMYB156 was expressed in all the tissues tested, with the highest expression in old leaves and lowest expression in roots
Transcript accumulation of PtoMYB156 was also detected throughout the stem, including xylem, phloem and bark.
GUS activity was detected in all tissues of transgenic plants, especially in vascular tissues of roots, stems and leaf veins
